section.title: Reading Assignment
section.p: Read Sections 9.2 and 9.3 of Applied Discrete Structures.
Also, turn in solutions to these exercises:

statement.p: The graph G has vertices with degree sequence 5, 3, 3, 2, 2, 1. How many edges does it have? If it is planar, into how many regions of the plane does it divide? Does G have an Eulerian path?
If a planar graph G with 7 vertices divides the plane into 8 regions, how many edges must G have?

A teacher decides to have their students grade one another's quizzes. The scheme that is devised is that when a bell is rung, each student is to pass their quiz to a classmate either to the front, back, right or left of themselves. Suppose that class is arranged in rectanglar configuration of 5 rows of seven students each. Is is possible for each student to get exactly one quiz to grade?
